verb.description: Disengage (something or part of something) and remove it.
examples: he detached the front lamp from its bracket
federal strings need to be detached to restore parental authority

verb.description: Leave or separate oneself from (a group or place)
examples: a figure in brown detached itself from the shadows
the newspaper detached itself from the political parties

verb.description: Send (a group of soldiers or ships) on a separate mission.
examples: our crew was detached to Puerto Rico for the exercise

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense discharge a gun): from French détacher, earlier destacher, from des- (expressing reversal) + attacher attach.
